title: ld.exe: unrecognized option '-zignore' when ld.exe: unrecognized option '-zignore'

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Trying to cross-compile for sparcv9-sun-solaris getting a error message for -zignore

I believe this was introduced when -z -ignore was seperated here
22d0ab0bc3627e94e953a2be981295440b52289e

Here is the documentation to [Solaris ld](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E26502_01/html/E29030/ld-1.html) that references the -z ignore

## Reproduce

``` bash
rustup target add sparcv9-sun-solaris
cargo new --bin hello && cd hello && cargo run --target=sparcv9-sun-solaris
```

config.toml
[target.sparcv9-sun-solaris]
linker = "gcc"

#### Error log

``` bash
C:\git\hello>cargo run --target=sparcv9-sun-solaris
   Compiling hello v0.1.0 (C:\git\hello)
error: linking with `gcc` failed: exit code: 1
  |
``` 

Let me know if you have any further questions and thank you for your time reading through this.
